content:
dENVER AP  Samples collected in  locations in eight rivers in the Colorado flooding zone show high levels of E PERIOD coli in the Boulder Creek and Big Thompson River watershed the state health department said Tuesday PERIOD

The testing also showed high levels of E PERIOD coli in locations in the South Platte Basin PERIOD The highest levels of E PERIOD coli were detected in Boulder and near Niwot PERIOD But no outbreaks of illness or communicable disease have been reported PERIOD

The samples were collected on Sept PERIOD  PERIOD

The state is tracking multiple spills from oil and gas operations in the South Platte Basin but the testing showed no evidence of contamination PERIOD

Although much attention was focused on spills from oil and gas operations it is reassuring the sampling shows no evidence of oil and gas pollutants said Larry Wolk chief medical officer of the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment PERIOD

A broken city of Boulder main allowed raw sewage to pour into Boulder Creek in the days following the worst of the flooding which began Sept PERIOD  PERIOD

Slightly lower levels were detected along Boulder Creek northeast of Boulder near Erie and near Boulder Creeks confluence with the St PERIOD Vrain PERIOD

Elevated levels were detected near the confluence of the St PERIOD Vrain and South Platte north of Platteville east of Milliken near the confluence of the South Platte and Big Thompson and long the Platte west of Kersey and near Orchard and Brush PERIOD Elevated levels also were found on the Big Thompson in two spots between Estes Park and Loveland PERIOD

The health department also sampled for metals that may have been released from mining areas but that analysis is not complete PERIOD

Five public drinking water systems remain on boil or bottled water advisories Jamestown Lyons Mountain Meadow Water Supply Lower Narrows Campground and Sylvan Dale Ranch PERIOD
